Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Russia on display
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Russia on display 
    Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Gifts leader Kim Jong Il received during his historic visit to the Russian Federation were displayed at the International Friendship Exhibition.
 He received precious gifts from President V.V. Putin and Russian people in different parts of Russia during his visit from July 26 to August 18.    
 On display in the exhibition hall are some of the 300 gifts Kim Jong Il received from President Putin, chief delegates of the president to the federal districts, ministries and their officials, administrators of regions and cities he stayed or passed and Russian people.

Increased share of expenses for upkeep of u.s. troops opposed
articles.content:
Increased share of expenses for upkeep of u.s. troops opposed 
    Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- More than ten citizens' organizations in South Korea including the people's action for the revision of the unequal South Korea-U.S. "status of forces agreement" called an emergency press conference in Seoul on November 12 and urged the authorities to oppose the increased share of the expenses for the upkeep of the u.s. troops, according to Radio No. 1 from Seoul.
 The organizations said that the South Korean side should dismiss the claim for the increased share of the expenses for the upkeep of the U.S. troops and cut it down at the upcoming South Korea-U.S. "annual security consultative meeting" in the U.S.
